tool_description: This tool utilizes AlphaFold2 to accurately predict the three-dimensional structure of proteins from their amino acid sequences. AlphaFold2 excels in structure prediction by incorporating evolutionary information through multiple sequence alignments (MSA) and predicted residue-residue contact maps. It performs exceptionally well for proteins with homologous sequences, offering high accuracy in determining protein folds. AlphaFold2 is particularly effective for understanding the structural aspects of well-characterized proteins and their functional roles.

optional_parameters.name: msa_mode
optional_parameters.description: Databases to use for creating the MSA. Default is UniRef30+Environmental. Single sequences can also be used without MSA, by setting its value to 'single_sequence'.

optional_parameters.name: template_mode
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the use of template information. If None, no templates are used. If 'pdb100', templates will be detected from the PDB100 database on the Colab public server. If 'custom', user-uploaded templates will be used.

optional_parameters.name: template_path
optional_parameters.description: Required if template_mode is set to 'custom'. This parameter should provide the directory with PDB or mmCIF files to provide as custom templates to the predictor.

return_values.name: structure_results
return_values.description: The predicted structure of the protein, saved as a PDB file, along with the corresponding MSA information.
